blurb: JavaScript is a scripting language, primarily used for creating dynamic websites and programming web servers. It's a very popular language, and supports a variety of programming paradigms.

key_features.title: Runs almost everywhere
key_features.content: Build web-pages, write backend, create database scripts, make mobile apps, design CLI-s, and more.

key_features.title: Use any programming style
key_features.content: Use prototype-based, object-oriented, functional, or declarative programming styles, and more.

key_features.title: No types required
key_features.content: Dynamically and weakly typed by default, gain typed confidence using Flow, JSDoc, or TypeScript.

key_features.title: Concurrency is safe
key_features.content: Async/await, dedicated workers, or state sync in shared workers. No deadlocks or race conditions.

key_features.title: Largest package registry
key_features.content: No need to reinvent the wheel. Build on top of > 1.3 million packages (April, 2020).

key_features.title: Designed by a committee
key_features.content: Frequent updates, following ECMAScript, a general purpose, cross platform, vendor-neutral standard.
